content:
ADVF Enum

Definition

Specifies the requested behavior when setting up an advise sink or a caching connection with an object.

In this Article

[System.Flags]
public enum ADVF
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
Enum
ADVF

Remarks

For additional information about ADVF, see the MDSN library.

The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions.

Fields

ADVF_DATAONSTOP

For data advisory connections, assures accessibility to data.
ADVF_NODATA

For data advisory connections (stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject.DAdvise* or stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IConnectionPoint.Advise*), this flag requests the data object not to send data when it calls stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IAdviseSink.OnDataChange*.
ADVF_ONLYONCE

Requests that the object make only one change notification or cache update before deleting the connection.
ADVF_PRIMEFIRST

Requests that the object not wait for the data or view to change before making an initial call to stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IAdviseSink.OnDataChange* (for data or view advisory connections) or updating the cache (for cache connections).
ADVFCACHE_FORCEBUILTIN

This value is used by DLL object applications and object handlers that perform the drawing of their objects.
ADVFCACHE_NOHANDLER

Synonym for ADVFCACHE_FORCEBUILTIN, which is used more often.
ADVFCACHE_ONSAVE

For cache connections, this flag updates the cached representation only when the object containing the cache is saved.
